intro: Diplostephium gnidioides, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or red, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually small, narrow, and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. The fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in its native habitat.
